citation.article-title: Luteococcus japonicus gen. nov., sp. nov., a new gram-positive coccus with LL-diaminopimelic acid in the cell wall

p.s: Luteococcus (Lu.te.o.coc'cus. Lat. adj. luteus yellow; Gr. masc. n. coccus a grain; M.L. masc. n. Luteococcus yellow coccus)
Cells are spherical and 0.7 to 1.0 μm in diameter and occur singly, in pairs, or in tetrads.
Colonies are circular and smooth and may be cream colored to yellow.
The cells do not reduce nitrate to nitrite.
Acid is produced from glucose and some other sugars.
Propionic acid is formed from glucose as a major product.
Cell wall peptidoglycan contains LL-diaminopimelic acid, alanine, glycine, and glutamic acid (ca. 1:2:1:1).
The major cellular fatty acid is 16:1, and among the minor components a small amount of 2-OH iso-18:0 is also present.
Arabinose is present as a diagnostic sugar in the cell wall.
As polar lipids, phosphatidylinositol, diphosphatidylglycerol, and phosphatidylglycerol are present.
